intro: Rinorea decora, commonly known as the silverleaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and leathery, silver-green leaves. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Rinorea decora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
